intro: Stephanomeria virgata subsp. virgata, commonly known as the slender stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers in clusters. It is often found in coastal scrub and coastal dune habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
